text:
Great staff and the burgers at great.
Green chili is unreal!!
Anna and char were awesome.  
Really clean place and like I said, the burgers rock.  Try the green chilli
Ownership cares and makes it a great place for drinks and killer burgers.
Great service and food! The fried pickles are to die for and the green chili burger was amazing. Highly recommend!

A melt in your mouth burger experience. I had the Bar Code Burger, and it was literally oozing with flavor. I needed a couple of napkins because this burger was juicy. I can't wait until the next time I am in the area. Worth every penny, and great service.

When in Las Vegas make sure you plan on a making Bar Code Burger Bar one of your stops...for literally one of the best burgers I've ever had.   My husband and I received a recommendation to give it a try and we are so glad we did.  While we waited for the Bar Code House Burger and Chicken sandwich, we had the fried pickles.  Be sure and give those a try too! 
We definitely make this a "Go-To" when friends and family come to town. 
Guaranteed you won't be disappointed.

Had some of the best chicken strips I've ever had in my life. Great crowd, great food, great drinks. Also this bar is very reasonably priced.  Modern touch interior also sets a good vibe.   Bartender Anna is fantastic, she even has a selfie stick so make sure to ask for a picture!
Holy cow...these burgers are amazing!! I am stuffed but can't stop eating...nice bar too, very clean, friendly staff...Mondays are half off for locals, total deal!!

Was in town for March Madness and randomly came upon this place. What a good surprise! We got a burger with pablano peppers and the chicken strips. Both unbelievably delicious. The owner/chef was waiting our table and he was great. The set up, tvs, bar, space, shuffle board, food, service, everything was top notch. We went back a second time and had another great server and the same good food. Highly recommend!

Great place to relax have a good time.  Drinks are good food is great but the the bartender Anna!  By far one of the best in town.  My wife and I went in a month ago and when we came back she remembered us and our drinks!  That's service!

Great burgers, friendly staff (Neesa was great!), ample selections and a fun atmosphere.  Be sure to try the daily special burger and beer pairings.  The innovative burgers won't disappoint!  Vegetarian and health conscious options as well--all around great meal in the heart of the city.  Cheers!
Excellent. The food is much better than what you would typically expect from a bar/restaurant. Will definitely be coming back.

When you first walk inside this place looks awesome.  Nice clean and sexy atmosphere.  The servers are friendly and the food is even better.  I've tried just about everything on the menu and it all tastes great.  Some of the best burgers I've ever had.  Even the calamari and salads are good.  Not your everyday bar food.  I highly recommend it to everyone.

This is my favorite burger stop in town. Sadly I don't have a photo, I never have time before I devour my food here. The green chili burger is my personal favorite it has a perfect distribution of flavors and the size is perfect. The staff is always attentive and friendly I was greeted right when I walked in.  They have a good happy hour and discounts for dine-in locals which is great for us returning customers.

Usually, you walk into a bar and are overcome by darkness and the smell of cigarette smoke and desperation while people drop their paychecks into slot machines. That's not the case here. It's sparkling clean, they have a nice wide open floor plan, and quite the comfortable atmosphere. 

The servers and bartenders are friendly and welcoming. They appear to be genuinely interested in building rapport with customers. 

The food was great. The burger was juicy, thick, and flavorful. They cooked the peppers until they were tender, not mushy or soggy. 

We indulged in the old fashioned cocktails which had a little kick. I can appreciate the fact that the bartender didn't rip us off with weak drinks. 

The fried pickles were served sizzling hot, crispy and spicy. They're pickle chips rather than spears which makes the perfect fried pickle. It's not too wet and doesn't stay scorching hot for too long. 

I'll definitely make regular visits here. They offer entertainment on Friday nights. It's near UNLV, so expect a younger, rowdier crowd to blow in around the evening hours.

Probably the worst service I've had in my life. The bar is nice and food looked great. However, I feel as though the bartender had either a very bad day or something very tragic happened in her life. From the start she uttered rude remarks to my friends and I, such as "Of course you are on different tabs." We felt slightly uncomfortable, nonetheless I continued to be polite. However, I feel she crossed the line when she told me that I ordered incorrectly off the happy hour menu (which is the only menu I had in my hand while ordering) and that I needed to mention to her that it was happy hour for her to honor it. She followed that by telling my friends and myself that we are rude and have been rude since we walked in, even though I was only in the bar for 10 minutes and had only a single interaction with her. I was utterly shocked, thinking she possibly confused me for another guest somehow. I can honestly say that she treated me like she had a personal vendetta against me. I hope that she was just having a very bad day and that this type of behavior is an outlier from her normal actions. 
I work in the service industry at a very high volume venue in Vegas and have never seen this kind of service from anyone on my staff. I felt so uncomfortable that I had to leave immediately after hearing all the remarks she was making. I will never be coming back to this bar again because of the woman who bartends on Sunday at 5pm. 

On a side note, the male bartender was very polite.
Great service. Clean atmosphere off the strip.  Mason provided excellent service and a friendly attitude!  Would definitely come back on our next vegas trip.

I've been stopping by after work for a few weeks now and it's great.  Last night I had one of the BEST burgers at a bar in a long time.  I recommend the Green Chile Cheeseburger.  I'm not sure but I think the ketchup is even home made.  The staff is nice and being a trivia player there are tons of boards.  If you're a local, stop in on Mondays for half off drinks.  Great job guys!
Fun night out for hubby and me. Great decor (nice but not uppity). Andrea was AWESOME!! The Mule and Blood Orange Old Fashioned were PERFECT!!   Pool table and darts. Good times!!

Good food and modern atmosphere. While we were eating we even discussed making this our go to bar that's close to home. Only disappointment is that we were given the happy hour menu and discussed it with our waitress and never were we told that happy hour ended an hour earlier. Not in writing or verbally. So when our bill came we asked about the prices and we were then told happy hour was over. Immediately the waitress realized the mistake and took it to her manager without us saying anything. A few minutes later the manager comes over and quickly says that all he can do is give us the "industry discount". Ended up being $6 off our total bill which was not even half of what it would have been if we got the happy hour deal. He spoke so fast and admitted they were wrong for not having it printed on the menu then walked away immediately without even giving us the chance to discuss. Overall good experience but not so great customer service from management.

First of all, great prices on the drinks with a wide selection too! Living in Vegas that's hard to find! Great atmosphere and decor. It's a great place to hang out any day of the week. Plus the fried pickles are delicious!

Lets talk chicken wings. The bangin wings are exactly what the name says BANGIN! I definitely recommend getting a order of wings when you come here. The fried pickles are pretty good also. The place was clean and the staff was amazing. Our bartender was awesome, we never waited long to get our drinks. She made our experience that much better.
Best burger place in town! I recommend this to anyone who likes a little spice to their burgers!

For a bar open less than a year it still smells so fresh;no smoke or food smell and the food is excellent!
Can't wait to go back!
I like what they did to the place in Motto hadn't been here for years totally different from what it was before. Food is good & reasonable. On Mondays everything half off the menu
My burger was ultra juicy, and the service was even better. I can't wait to try the lamb burger next time.
The chicken strippers during happy hour is my go-to play here. Besides the smoking, I enjoy the place and the sauce for the strips is really good too. Also, the fried zucchini is great.

5 stars for the food, -3 stars for the service. 

We went during the last half of happy hour and the food was pretty great. Props to the cook. We had chicken fingers, wings, and zucchini fries. Everything was delicious! Easily one of the juiciest and crunchiest chicken fingers I've had, but I don't think we'd ever go back solely because of the crappy service. 

There was only one barista working, so I can understand her feeling overwhelmed or aggitated (even though there was roughly only 5 other customers aside from us). She was rude and I'm not sure she knows how to work in hospitality. We also ordered some chicken fingers to-go and when she served us the order on the plate, I had to remind her I asked for it to-go. To which her response was, "No you didn't say that." After a few moments of awkward stares in silence, my boyfriend had to just come out and ask for a take-out container. She should be fired, honestly, seeing as others have had the same crappy service from probably the same female server.

Recommend you try the bar food here only if you have the patience to ignore servers with lousy attitudes.

We were looking for a great burger in Vegas that was off the strip and didn't cost a fortune.  We found Bar Code Burger Bar on Yelp and based on the reviews decided to give it a try.  When we walked in the place was practically empty with two people sitting at the bar and one guy sitting at a table.  It's a sports bar that serves food, so don't expect your typical restaurant setting.  The atmosphere is a little off.  I can't really put my finger on it, but maybe it's because it was not busy.  The staff was very friendly.  From the bartender to the manager, the service was great!
I ordered the BBQ Big Burger and it was a great burger!  Much better than all these so called specialty burger places.  The burger was very juicy and the flavors with the bbq sauce, cheese and toppings was incredible.  This would be the perfect burger to cure any hangover!
Service was slowed down by a large group that came in and that did hurt this rating. But the food was good. The squid was good as was the lamb burger but the chicken strips stuck out as champs.

This was a great find in Las Vegas. The 3 meat combination they use for the burgers is top notch. I ordered the NY burger which is topped with pastrami, Swiss cheese and a spicy sauce was excellent. We also ordered the Squid Vicious and zucchini fries. Both were very good. 
It's a full bar and a good selection of both bottled and draft beers.
It's on our list for future Vegas trips.

I meet with a group of ladies over coffee each and every week. The service is exemplary and our wants are always met. I highly recommend this restaurant for your work functions and meetings. 

Thank you for creating this delightful space.

Staff is extremely friendly.  Chicken tenders were moist and full of flavor.  The burgers are always amazing.  A wonderful selection and you can always customize your own.  The meat is tender and you can taste the freshness.  Definitely have a burger!

OMG!! We came in here for a paint party, the food was good, the service, and the drinks were on point(just like we like it). Our waitress Nisa is phenonmal!  We will definitely return just for her SERVICE.   Thanks for making our evening top notch!

Amazing people amazing food. The bartenders are off/the-chain......stop in you won't be disappointed.
Please try the lamb burger. The chef actually came to our table and explained the age to perfection  meats he use in the grilling process....!!!
Failed to make burgers well done on 3 different trips.... Weren't just pink either, but bleeding

Anthony was super rad. We stopped in randomly on Sunday, starving! Anthony and the amazing cook on the day shift suggested a burger that was so delicious... I can't even put it into words. He also suggested the chicken sandwich... so we split both... and ate every bite. We had a few drinks, the peach shot was delicious and were entertained by these guys. I can't wait to come back. Great service, great food. I'd rate this place ten stars if I could.
Best burger I've eaten! Fairly priced drinks. I really want to go to happy hour here. Their fried pickles are awesome. Definitely affordable for a college student like me.

This place is such a hidden gem! This is our fourth time visiting the bar code and each time we have been here Ryan has exceeded our expectations. He has always accommodated my friends and I  special requests and makes us feel at home. This is  for sure my definite go to late night spot! The food is great also!!!

I've gone a few times now, love it! Great place to catch the game! Food is good and the staff have all been pretty friendly! Order the 2am tots if you're looking for a delicious snack! They're my favorite!

Lately it seems like burger spots are opening up all over the Vegas valley. Bar Code is proof you can get a great burger off the strip at a great price with a minimal walk from your car!! They have an excellent variety of burgers and their chicken tenders and sandwiches are excellent as well. You don't have to go to a place sporting a celebrity chef name on it to get excellent food! The best part is you also don't pay the outrageous prices the big name chefs charge!! The atmosphere is great with plenty of tvs and a friendly staff to boot!!

The food is really good here however service sucks. My boyfriend & I always come and the workers aren't the friendliest. We have talked to the manager several times and he doesn't do anything either. One time me, and my boyfriends friend got our food 30 minutes before he did and his burger came out literally ice cold as the bartender let it sit up there as we ate our hot food. We also waited 40 minutes for 1 order of chicken strippers. By far the suckiest place and we will never go back.

This place is amazing. The bartenders make great craft cocktails, Craft Beers on tap like Big Wave, Elysian Space Dust IPA, Franziskaner Hefeweizen etc and THE FOOD? Wow! Best burger I've ever had. MUST TRY the green chile burger, all house made ingredients on a poblano bun. FANTASTIC. 
This is the absolute best bar in the area.
They have karaoke on Friday and Saturdays, pool table, darts, jukebox, shuffleboard, beer pong, etc Everything that makes a great local spot!

I came here and had the best Vegas experience. I was on a mission to eat something delicious and that I found. I got the chicken tenders, hand breaded and fried per order. there was no fat, you could tell it was hand trimmed and just juicy and delicious. I had tater tots which were good but nothing crazy. My friend had a burger and said it was flavorful and seasoned well. You are able to smoke inside since it has gaming affiliated with it. 

There are some pool tables, darts and a nice patio area. I will be back as I still remember the chicken tenders and service which was exceptional.

The staff were friendly and knowledgeable. Food was amazing; I highly recommend the Jade Buddha (cocktail).

Their house made sauces were all very delicious. I'm torn between the Wasabi Ranch and the Sriracha Ranch as my favorites.

I am STILL thinking about the food here! It's so so good! Wish I lived closer- perfect for happy hour or for good eats before/during a game. Staff is great too- but the FOOD tho!!! Try the burgers and the fried pickles!

BAR CODE is a great burger spot and a really cool bar.  I love the vibe from the blue LED lights behind artsy silver panels to their paintings of singers "The Weekend" and Elvis behind the bar.  They have a great jukebox that you can play from an app on your phone.  The burgers are amazing and the chicken strips are delicious.  I also really enjoyed their zucchini fries!  This is a great place to have food and drinks near the strip without strip prices.

OMG! So delicious!!!
I ordered the bar code burger off of postmates because they were offering free delivery and the pictures of the food looked sooooo good!
I ordered my burger as a lettuce wrap and was not dissapointed!
 The meat itself was cooked perfectly and everything else on the burger gave it such decadence! Very unique tasting with the aioli and jam! My order came with fries. I look forward to going into the bar and trying other burgers, they sound equally amazing!

I was skeptical when reading the reviews but this place is awesome!!! I had the Americana Burger.  First of all,  you hav a choice of how you like your burger cooked.  Well, medium rare,  etc.... 
Its a huge 1/2 pound burger, with cheese crunchy onions,  the best pickles I hav ever had,  ketchup and mustard. I could not eat it all. 
After you hav indulged,  there are TV screens everywhere, darts, pool table, shuffle board, and a full bar.
Enjoy!!!

If you're going to open a bar in Vegas, you better have good food. Barcode has that nailed, along with entertainment in the form of pool, shuffleboard, and even free wifi. We can't all just sit around and drink and play video poker. We have to eat, too.

Burgers are the specialty, and as my favorite server Crystal put it, you really can't go wrong with any of them. The standouts would be the Green Chile Burger (pepper jack and jalapenos make for a spicy bite) and the NZ Lamb burger (feta and harissa? yes please!). They also offer breakfast items, hotdogs, and a bunch of apps- pound of wings was pretty solid, too. 

Note that this bar is NOT non-smoking, which is probably the only other thing I'd recommend to make it even better. That said, their ventilation system must be new because the only time I noticed was when a smoker sat directly beside me.

Th service was trash. The food was horrible. The guy tending the bar was okay but his attention was clearly on the regulars he knows and he paid no mind to the new people who arrived (i.e. me and my boyfriend) the machines at the bar didn't work and instead of the guy trying to help he was like oh well and went off to help his other customers.... by far the worst service ever.
A fun little hidden gem near my office. Have been here twice and never disappointed. Made from scratch food, friendly service and great prices.
The food was great, had the 2am tots and bbq burger. The only issue was we ordered online for noon pickup and it was incorrectly placed for 8am

This burger place was a hidden gem that will not be a constant spot for me. The food was amazing, the drinks were ideal and the service was amazing. I went there with some colleagues from school and was shocked knowing that I never made it there before. Awesome experience and I will be back.

Best burger that I have had in a long time by far. But damn I feel like a fatty now. This burger was definitely a filling burger like one you would make at home. I choose the Chili Burger. It was so good. I will definitely be back. Super happy I didn't eat alot today
 Lol.

You haven't had a burger until you've had a burger from here! Executive chef Joe Valdez III has ruined it for all other burgers! We also had his Chicken Strippers....TOP NOTCH!!! Not only can you taste the ingredients that make the food here EXTRA DELICIOUS, you can taste the LOVE! I can't wait to try all of the other Burgers from here!

Been passing by Bar Code everyday day at work and finally decided to come in with my girl. The bar is really clean and the service was excellent! We got the chicken strips, friend pickles and green chili burger. Everything was bomb! I will definitely be back!

This place has the best fried pickles...possibly in the world and the chicken strippers are the best as well.  Inside is good with all of the tv's.  Order take out or delivery as well.  Haven't had a burger but they look great

What a great place to enjoy a burger. All fresh ingredients, unique burger recipes and friendly service. I highly recommend that everyone give this a try. Shout out to my server Neesa! Thanks so much for recommending the BBQ burger!

I was pleasantly surprised by bar code.   The bar is completely redone and has a very hip vibe.  Bartenders and servers are very personable. The food here is amazing. We had the pickle chips, yummy!   Some of the best I've had in Vegas.  I also had the green chili burger.  The burger was cooked perfectly, not dry and not rare, just the perfect juiciness.  I highly recommend Bar Code.
Awesome burgers and great beer selection and the bartender described each burger to us and he was really knowledgeable.

Love this bar!  I've been several times when I've traveled to Vegas and have always had a fun time here.  The karaoke was a nice added touch.  Everyone that sang could really sing and my girlfriends and I sang along.  The drinks are great, the food is outstanding.  I can't stop thinking about the fried pickles.  My friends had burgers and both of them said they were perfect!

I had an early morning flight to catch and needed a place to get a super late bite while waiting to go to the airport. Bar Code was perfection. There was only one customer and one person working, but the vibe was chill (as opposed to creepy) and our server was very friendly. 

The food was very good. I had the tater tots (tot bombs per the menu) and the bar code burger. Really tasty and fresh, even at 3am. 

It was the little things that made me so thankful for this place: the fact that they truly are 24/7, the music wasn't too loud, the server was friendly and prompt, it was clean and bright. Simple, but perfect!

Burgers were outstanding as well as the service. Also your choice of games is the best in town!!! Love it and will be back, but please, smoking belongs outside! I am sticking to my guns on the smoking opinion but damn it this is my new favorite bar! 
I definitely recommend you stop by for a game of shuffle board, some poker games, or some amazing grub!

Great service and friendly regulars won some money playing games and they have amazing food
Thanks! I'll be back for sure : )

I met a co-worker for lunch today at Bar Code. They had 50% off the bill on Monday's. I'd never been here before but my co-worker has and made a few suggestions. Their speciality is burgers, but they have salads and sandwiches too. I had a burger with poblano peppers, jalape√±os, onion strings and pepper jack cheese (I forgot the name). The burger was GREAT. Toasted bun, good size patty and it came with great fries. Service was good. It seemed like the waitress was a bit overwhelmed and could have used some help but she did a great job. They have an area for live music, gaming machines at the bar and a patio (I hope they add tables out there). I'll be back!!!

This place gave terrible service very rude staff. Nobody ever came to check on us or give us refills. Loud music made me deaf and food was just ok. Burgers were greasy and overpriced. Overall stick to PTs, better atmosphere and nicer people!
This place is #1 in Las Vegas! The scene is amazing! The food is to DIE for! And the staff is THE BEST! You will NOT be disappointed!
Very good prices. Good selection of beers on tap. My burger was delicious. I would have given this place 5 stars if my fries hadn't been a little undercooked.

Yum! Great New local find. 95% from scratch kitchen where even the ketchup is homemade. Fresh cut fries could use a bit of work, but the burger.... Mmmmmmm good. First time here. Service and food we're so good I'm sure we'll be back.

I was there last night to watch the Vegas Knights hockey game, and on top of the excellent service (no exaggeration) I am a chicken strip fan and these are the best chicken strips I have ever eaten!! They are called "Chicken Strippers" they are made with a light batter with the spices and seasonings on the outside and inside. My friends has the fried pickles and other appetizers and everyone was very satisfied, they have shuffleboard, pool tables, and other activities all during the week and are open 24hours. 
I will be back soon!

Great little spot. Incredible burgers. Maybe one of the best I've had. Ground chuck, brisket and short rib go into it. Guacamole is outstanding, highly recommend that on your burger. Very good, will be back for sure!!

What a nice relaxing bar to go and have a burger that is not so greasy that it drips on your shirt. This is a great location on Flamingo to stop in and just have a bite to eat in the middle the day. I just did and enjoyed myself. Jim I think we should have dinner here and ladies paint day location is here. Why drive to the Northwest!!!
 8/28/2017I just had lunch here today and got the turkey burger sandwich. It had guacamole on it and tomatoes in this great sauce. Have you ever got a burger that you hated the bun? This burger is not that burger. In fact I rarely eat all the bun... I ate the whole bun AND burger!! Best burger joint in Las Vegas!

So we came on a very non busy Sunday we ordered the tater tots and there was only a few pieces for the price it was not worth it since it seemed like they threw cheese,sour cream, and bacon on a skimpy amount of tots and we got the burger and it was pretty dry. We were hoping better from the faculty. Maybe ill give it another try later on. But i didn't like my experience.
Their Devyn Salad is delicious, perfect for a light summer meal. Very friendly staff and an inviting atmosphere. I'll definitely be coming back.

I came with a group of people and we ordered the special with green poblano peppers, the Americana vegetarian burger with a lettuce wrap as well as a few other burger options. All of our burgers were very good and the fries came with spicy ketchup. 

The only downside is that the place is filled with smoke. I guess you're able to smoke inside. Im not from here and didn't know. If that doesn't bother you, check out this spot for a good burger.

We wanted to find a place where we could have watch the game and have good food and beer. This place had good Yelp reviews so we decided to check it out.

We ordered based on the recommendations we read on here. We got the 2 am tots, zucchini fries, deviled eggs and the chicken wings. I guess we had too high of expectations because the food is simply just okay. It's bland and really doesn't have much of a flavor. I will say this, the 2 am Tots we're good. I'd maybe order 2 since they are on the smaller portion side. The deviled eggs had a good presentation but the taste was just not there. Imagine a taste like a deviled egg platter from Albertsons and just add  pieces of bacon to it. Still trying to find a good wing spot, these just didn't cut it. The sauce they put on them has an over powering ginger taste. I found myself having to wipe some of the sauce off because it was giving me a weird after taste. The zucchini fries were a bit on the soggy side, they could've been cooked a little longer. The wasabi ranch sauce doesn't help them one bit, we dipped the zucchini in it and never touched it again. 

Now the bartender was also our server. She was fantastic. Girl was the only one there and managed to take care of the entire establishment alone. She was definitely on her A game!!! 

I'd probably only come back for drinks, not the food. This place is cool if you wanna come for drinks and to watch sports. They have TV's everywhere so any where you sit is a good seat.

If you love burgers you have to come here. I had the barbeque big burger with fries and shared some fried pickles with some friends. The beer menu was on point because I love a tasty craft beer to enjoy with a burger. The service is excellent and we all definitely will return to try different things on the menu.
Great place to grab a burger, food was great and filling.  I also loved the touch on the ketchup too.  Plenty of beer on tap as well.

5 stars hands down!!!!!

My friend brought me here and I must say I'm sooooo glad that they did :) the happy hour is great and the food is AMAZING we were greeted right away and given menus happy hour and reg menu our forgot the waitress lady name but she was super friendly and service was great never left our drinks empty :) I loved it so much I came back the NEXT day lol 

We got the chicken tenders eggs and salad with the shrimp I can't exactly remember the name the tenders were juicy and not sure what sauce they had on the side but it was great and the eggs omg soooooo yummy ( I got them on happy hour ) it came with four which was perfect portion size for me...... I only took a few bites of my salad but it was delicious and fresh 

I will definitely make this a local spot for me to come and if you havnt been here you should make it a priority to visit

Most disappointing was the small portions given during g happy hour. I'm going to guess it's only the happy hour portions that are small. Either way it's a scam. Plenty of better food and drink in the area.
We came to this bar to watch the VGK game. Seriously the best burgers and service in town!!! We definitely will be coming back to eat here. AMAZING!!!!
Great happy hour prices and excellent food to go with the variety of alcohol. Sports type themed but with modern flare.

Came here with the family on a Wednesday. First timers and wow the food was great! I ordered the wings and they did not disappoint. Services was 50/50. Bar tender was a little rude when we were ordering our drinks but our server made up for her rudeness. I'll stop by again if I'm ever in the area but probably won't seat at the bar if the same bar tender is working.

We order here for pick up often. I love their Americana hamburger, sriracha ranch and my bf loves the hangover burger! The past two times our sauce was missing and we had a fish sandwich (which we didn't order) so I just have to make sure its correct before we take off. It typically takes 20 minutes for the food to be done, which isn't bad. Definitely one of my favorite places for hamburgers.

My boyfriend and I went to this beautiful bar around 1 am. There was one group of people and just a couple single people at the bar. The door was locked so we had to press the door bell. The bartender came and opened the door for us and checked our ID because only 21+ year olds are allowed in there. 

We took a seat at one of the tables unsure if we were allowed to because many bars only let you sit at the bar after a certain time but the bartender was also our waiter and was very attentive. He quickly grabbed us our water and took our order when we were ready. 

We order their amazing Bangin' Wings to share, a whole pound of wings. They only have one signature sauce and it really is delicious. It is a little BBQ-y and just a perfect little hint of spicy. They also give you a homemade dipping sauce which is a lot lighter than ranch or bleu cheese but still good.

I ordered the BBQ Burger. It had this wonderful blueberry BBQ sauce on it. I loved it. It also had amazing white cheddar cheese melted on it and thick meaty bacon but still crispy. I didn't read the menu thoroughly and didn't catch that there would be pulled pork on this burger as well but I ate many bites without noticing and it was so good but once I pulled it off it was even better because I love beef way more than I do pork. The buns were toasted and buttered perfectly. I got the fresh fruit for my side instead of fries and they gave me fresh, juicy strawberries and blueberries! Yum! 

Boyfriend ordered their Degenerate (Hangover) Burger. It was super savory. It had all the toppings that make that perfect "hangover burger" - like an egg, bacon, onion strings etc. it was SO GOOD. He stuck with the fries for his side and they were perfectly crispy and salted. They also make a homemade ketchup that kind of tastes like sriracha and ketchup mixed together... it was interesting.

Overall, we loved the food here. Everything was amazing and the inside of the place is so spacious and modern. It was also quiet and very peaceful. It looks like all the furniture is new and the whole place is super clean. You're allowed to smoke in here but it doesn't at all smell like smoke, it is very well ventilated. The waiter was nice (he even lit my boyfriend's cigarette for him!) he always made sure we had everything we needed. The food came out quickly and was warm! 

We will definitely be back!!

The food was amazing & it was surprisingly not extremely busy for a Friday night. The only reason it's not five stars is for the service today. It seemed there was only one server on duty at the time & just about every table was occupied! Although she did the best she could serving us, I would hope to see more servers in the future to have much better service!

We'll be back though!

Best fried pickles ever!
Best customer service I've ever had!

Beers on tap are different than most.

Since discovering this bar a couple months ago this is my favorite burger place in town!  Service always great and Andrea is a sweetheart and definitely a go-getter after talking with her for a bit. Thanks again for offering the best burgers in town!
Great burger, great sides and I will be back for the next monthly special. I got the green chile burger double sized and zucchini fries. Yum Yum in my tum tum.

Best burgers in town! Also no need to endure the hell that is the strip! I had the green Chile burger. It was quite nice. I will be back...most likely on Sunday for the build-your-own Bloody Mary bar. Yasssss.

I've been here a few times, and a few time before when it was Murphy's Law. I'll say the food is good, though the atmosphere may have been better before. Every time I've been to Bar Code there's either been an issue with the beer (Kirin had some serious flaws) or they were out of beer. Last night when we went they were out of Kirin, Stella, Elysian Space Dust, and one other draft beer. The staff was very friendly and apologetic, but if you're going to carry that much draft beer, it'd be nice to actually be able to drink it.

But.. their food saves them. The menu is definitely mostly burgers, which I wasn't really in the mood for. They have a breakfast menu served all night so I ordered a Breakfast TABLE sandwich, which is a BLT with avocado and a fried egg. I wouldn't order this for breakfast necessarily but it was friggin awesome. Like why have I not had a BLT with a fried egg before? The bread soft but sturdy, the lettuce was springy and fresh and the sandwich itself was huge. The fries were decent, I don't really like hand cut fries. I wish they could serve tater tots as a substitute for fries but the server informed us that they portion the tots out for the 2am tots appetizer which.. doesn't really make sense to me. I had a bite of my boyfriends BBQ burger and it was great, though not really my style. Somehow they stack BBQ pork and bacon onto this burger. It's a monster, but very good. The last time I was here it was happy hour and we ordered a few of the appetizers. I remember liking the fried pickles and tots. Really good happy hour deals. 

The bar is rather large, with 3-4 different seating areas besides the bar. They also have a patio, though it faces right onto busy Flamingo Road. It was a good spot to catch a Golden Knights game, play shuffleboard and hit the jukebox. There's a stage in the corner and I think they have karaoke or comedy nights or something, though I haven't checked that out. If you're looking for a burger and want to watch a sports game or gamble in a less smoky dark bar this is a good pick.

Came here for a work event and I couldn't leave anymore pleased! Anthony was more than helpful with questions about the menu!! Everything was cooked perfectly and the vibe of the Golden Knights helped even more!! Will be back soon!!

Had drinks and appetizers today. Staff is very attentive. Entire bar room and bathrooms immaculately clean. The wings were crispy and cooked perfectly. Great spot to have drinks, food and watch the game.
Brett is the beeeeeest eva, this bar is one of thee best! Bartenders, owner, servers, everyone is awesome!

Nice place, decent gaming, and great food. I come to see the bartender Anna twice a week so I know the location. However the last two visits, I drove right past. What prompted me to write this review is that the outside sign is not lit for at least a month. Food, drinks and service(especially Anna) is great, but you can't see it. Change the light bulbs or something.

Went on a Thursday night! They had music bingo! Which was super fun!! It's a great atmosphere! Really cool place to take a bunch of friends.. drink and have fun! And the food is good too!!! I had the bar code burger protein style!!! Yuuuuum!!!
Have yet to try a burger, though the fries are pretty good. I'm not a resident but I will consider returning-- staff was nice, and wasn't an issue when I needed a place to charge my phone.
This place is awesome! I make it a point to come to this place everytime I make it to Vegas

What do The Weeknd and Elvis have in common? ...Actually, I really don't know, but Bar Code's got both of them in the form of artistic canvases juxtaposed along their wall. I guess that's the beauty and basis of what a gastropub is -- a fusion.

Gastropubs often straddle the line of restaurant and pub. Here you have your typical wines, beer, and liquor... and then you also have your bar food, but with a tad more quality and served with a sprinkle of fancy, if you will. 

My friends and I stopped in on a weekday, catching happy hour. (Every day: 3p-6p, then 11p-2a) I was pleasantly surprised at how clean the bar was, open layout, with shuffleboard, pool, darts, etc. If you look closely, you can muster out the memories of the evolution of this bar: Murphy's Law and Barefoot Bob's Beachbar. My only gripe is that your clothes will smell like you fell into an ashtray afterwards. 

Service was good. Our waitress was patient and kept checking in on us. I tried the BANGIN' WINGS (bbq wings with bleu cheese)  and the PICKLE SCHNITZELS (deep fried pickle slices). Both were appetizing and great to munch on in between sips. My Jameson and ginger ale was only $4 for HH. Their appetizers are also half off during this time. 

So yeah, this bar was pretty chill. The clientele was a mixture. Despite its proximity to the university, it wasn't quite college central like you'd find at Stake Out, and although the food exudes the vibe of Park on Fremont and amenities like Gold Spike, it's not quite downtown hipster either. It's hard to pinpoint.
Ah! I love this place so much! I went like 3 times in one week. Brought my friend and bf. I couldn't stop bragging about it. You have to try the zucchini fries and these burgers are to die for!

A really welcoming local bar / food spot near UNLV, just down from the Flamingo & Maryland Pkwy. intersection. Their beer selection is great (I like their Franziskaner Weissbier), great staff, and they even have a veggie burger (order your burger as Code Green)! A spacious spot to hangout with friends or have a quickie drink / bite to eat!

When we have friends in town we always go OFF the strip and THIS place is our "Go To" place. We love Bar Code! Super nice bartenders and the owner even comes out and mingles with the guests. We don't drink fancy cocktails but if you like them they have them. And the food...is really good! Try the Chicken Strippers...they are THE BEST you have ever had. Cane's who?? Burgers and Bar Code Chicken sandwich are really good too.

I have eaten here several times since it opened and the food is amazing!  I don't frequent bars but I'll go anywhere that has great food and this place definitely qualifies.  My favorite things on the menu so far are the zucchini fries and the Health Code salad.  As a vegetarian I really like that you can not only make any burger veggie-style but that there are other meatless options as well.  It's also clean and has a hip vibe to it.

Unfortunately I have to give Bar Code a two star rating. Why? Because I read all the yelp reviews and was set on getting a tasty burger with a side of fried pickles and a beer. Sadly when I got there my friend and I were not given any inclination we were customers.

The waitress didn't acknowledge us for a several minutes so we went and sat down at one of the four high tables they have towards the middle. She came to the other tables around us twice and didn't say anything to us. So we got up and went to the bar.

Again sitting there we didn't get asked if we wanted drinks or food. The entire visit was about 20 minutes before we decided to leave and head to the Crown. Where, may I add, we were greeted immediately.

The inside looked nice with tons of TV's to watch the game and it looks better than the previous bar that was there. I just don't see myself coming back, even if the food sounds delicious.

The food was nothing amazing and the service was hardly existent. I want to like this place more but still not sure if i would bother returning. I went with a group of six for lunch (1pm) with only 4 other customers in the restaurant and still seemed to get the bare minimum of service. There was only one female bartender working the bar and the restaurant. It took some time for us to get waters, iced teas and half the menus provided were happy hour menus that weren't valid for 3 more hours. 4 out of the 6  burgers were correct however completely cold along with the fries, the "vinaigrette" for the salad is red wine vinegar only, and the burger ordered with a veggie patty came as a turkey patty so that burger had to be completely remade. Taste wise the fries were good but would have potentially been amazing if they weren't cold. Those who ordered turkey burgers from our group said the taste was really good and was a large patty however would have been better not cold. I don't eat meat so i love that they have a veggie burger that also looked to be made in house which is even better but the lack of service is worth it for me. Also to get our bill i had to go to the bar and wait till i could wave her down. 

My final complaint is that during our visit, next to us were two "models" being entertained by two men who we later realized we're going to be photographed for the restaurants promos. One of the gentlemen is i'm assuming an owner or manager because he's in half the instagram photos and we still managed to receive poor service with them just 2 tables away.
Andrea is the best server in town!  Wonderful experience and phenomenal burgers and service.
These burgers are the bomb! Really delicious and unique. Super juicy and bursting with flavor. Wish there was no smoking in the bar, but what can I say , I'm from California.

Bar Code is the BEST! From the food to the friendly servers, everything is first class! The DEGENERATE BURGER is one not to be missed, and the DEVYN SALAD is simple yet scrumptious. The beer and cocktail prices are really reasonable especially for a bar so close to the Las Vegas Strip! Totally worth the trip, I'd recommend it over and over again!

Again months later we come in and there is ONE guy cooking, serving, and greeting.

The wait time for food was quite long. 
Burger and fries were cold. Chicken was fresh.
Didn't taste like anything special at all. Under seasoned and dry turkey patty. Chicken was moist but bland.

They need to stop being so cheap and hire MORE STAFF. This was ridiculous.   

So disappointed.

This place is awesome. The atmosphere is really chill and the place is extremely clean and modern. The food is absolutely phenomenal.  Between the killer sound system, darts, pool table, beer pong, shuffle board and killer selection of cocktails you can't possibly go wrong here.

A very good burger no question, but no better than any of the other bar-burgers, or culinary burgers available around town.
I had the Hangover burger at $11.95 and it was declicious; moist, flavorful and balanced between carbs, vegetables and proteins. 

Would I make an extra effort to have another one? No.
If i were in the area and craving a burger, would I go? Maybe. But I might go to The Dispensary or Badger Cafe instead. I might even go to Smashburger on Maryland between Flamingo and Tropicana.

And oh by the way, the 50% locals discount that many yelpers talk about in their reviews: it's over. 
No more discounts for locals...and that's from a locals bar.

This place is great, the food was on point and amazing fried pickles, the American burger was soooooo good and the wife got the pastrami burger and boy did it hit the spot.  With Christine behind the bar you will have fun and have a great experience,  she rocks....she 9nly works 8-4 so come see her.

Came here for Sunday football and drinks. The bartender Anthony has a sweet mustache and looks like Ray Romano and thinks he's funny. Also he loves to talk about family feud. Sounds like a great movie idea by the way. Will return.

The service wasn't really that good. She took forever to get our drink order and didn't seem like  she was in a good mood. The 2am tots are definitely not as good as I thought. That being said the hangover burger was definitely on point and the spicy ketchup was so so good.

Getting ready to leave town and we were looking 4 sunthin to eat.....thank u yelp lol!! Oooommmggg by far the best burger I've ever had!! I got the Bar Code burger.....im so full & in love right now lol!! I will drive from LA just to get this burger & go back home!! Thanks Chef Lucky!! Our bartender Anthony was the bomb!!

This is my favorite spot to have lunch, by far!  Everything we have ordered is fresh and tastes great.  The burgers are fantastic.  I'm not sure, but I think they use a blend of different cuts of meat and I think even a little pork.  The flavor of the meat is just too good to be regular hamburger alone.  Even the chicken fingers are worth getting every time you go.  There is nothing frozen about anything we have ordered there.  The one thing I can say negative is that it does tend to take a little longer to get our food than other places, but I can honestly say that it is well worth the wait because we know that it will be great.  If it takes a couple of minutes longer to make a great burger, then I am all for it!  I know the place doesn't look like much on the outside, but they have done a great job of decorating and making it look and feel like a great place to hang out on the inside.  It is extremely clean on the inside....I am really picky about that.  Everyone I I take there is pleasantly surprised, when they walk through the door. They have a pool table, shuffleboard, TV's to watch the game, and I believe video slots at the bar (I don't gamble, so I can't say I know for 100% sure).  The staff is always pleasant, and the service is always great.  If this is anywhere near you, I can honestly say you won't be disappointed!

Idk how I found this place to bookmark it,  but it was a good find. I came in about 1130pm and we ordered fried pickles, deviled eggs, buffalo wings, and a burger. The fried pickles & deviled eggs were on the happy hour menu at a discounted price. Very good deal!!!! Fried pickles were great. Deviled eggs, ok, but I've had better. He said his wings were good, but he wasnt happy that he asked for all flats and got 2 flats only. Plus he said he could've used more sauce. My burger was requested well done & to me it was medium maybe. It was a good burger, but would've been great if prepared as requested! Overall we enjoyed our meal. My drink was good too. I'll go back to try breakfast since they're 24/7 hours. Service was pretty good too.

Bar Code Burger Bar - Las Vegas, NV (Flamingo Rd.)

What the heck took me so long to give Bar Code Burger Bar a try?  The bar is clean, the service is excellent, and their burgers are phenomenal.  Their burgers are all house made.  Each patty is a combination of ground chuck, short rib, and brisket.  If you love meat, then you'll love Bar Code Burger.  Their burger is huge, juicy, and packed with a ton of flavor.  I tried their Hangover Burger (cheese, egg, onion strings, and bacon) and the BBQ Big Burger (blueberry BBQ sauce, smoked Boston butt, cheddar, and bacon).  Both were delicious.  And here's the other good news, their burgers won't cost an arm and a leg.  A burger with fries cost around $11.  Want an even better deal?  Their food is 50% off for locals on Monday's. Bar Code has 8 different burgers, including a lamb and turkey burger, 2 types of dawgs, 3 chicken sandwiches, wings, and even a few breakfast dishes.  But if you ask me, it's all about their Hangover Burger. 

Bar Code Burger Bar is spacious, has a ton of flat screens, about 10 video poker machines, a pool table, and a shuffle board. Keep in mind that Bar Code is a bar and smoking is allowed.  Bar Code is ventilated well and I didn't even smell the smoke from the 3 smokers at the bar.  

The overall service at Bar Code is top-notch.  I could tell that our server wasn't just passionate about her customers, she was also passionate about their food.  She almost guaranteed that we would be very satisfied with their burgers.  And you know what?  I was extremely satisfied.

Murphy's Law. Barefoot Bob's Beach Bar. Now, Bar Code. 

Bar Code has gone the Gastropub route. With all Gastropub joints, they have this vague speakeasy/vintage type of feel with usually decent bar food but at gourmet burger prices. This is one of those places but was pleasantly surprised by the burger quality and the drink prices. 

The draft list did have some great choices. I was taking advantage of the Apocalypse IPA by 10 Barrel Brewing, which comes in around 7% ABV. A glass was $5. I thought that was a joke. It was so cheap that I had to get another one later. You know, twisting my arm here.

The menu looks like something that failed to get into The New Yorker. The Bar Code Burger description especially made me laugh. The two most hilarious items were: "proprietary short rib" which I had no idea what that meant and "newcastle onion jam" which I figured it could also be classified as Liverpool onion jam as I also had no idea what that meant. 

Great thing is that this all translates in the language of taste. It was a delicious burger. I don't know if it was the foreign jam, the bacon mayonnaise, or this copyrighted short rib(TM) but the flavors worked together. The burger was moist and flavorful and the bun, the foundation of any good burger, didn't get soggy or gross. They didn't even ask us how we wanted the burger cooked, but there's probably only one way to cook Bar Code's Proprietary Short Rib (TM) all rights reserved.

What they can keep is the Bryan's Tot Bombs. The description only says, "a labor of love, smoked tomato mayo." What you get for $8 is 12 tater tots whose insides are more like mashed potato consistency. 12 of those. There were four of us. That menu item needs an actual description. 

I want to love this place. I loved the previous places in their weird unique ways. One thing that concerns me is that it feels like just a place. Murphy's Law was... a place. That was both a Steelers bar and a Cardinals bar. Barefoot Bob's was supposed to be Beach themed, but it was Murphy's Law without the Steelers and Cardinals banners. This feels like Murphy's Law but with food served on fake newspapers and some garnish sprinkled on top.

In the meanwhile, I'll keep drinking these $5 craft draft beers and keep a positive mind.

2.5 Stars. The food is really good. 

We've been 2x now - first time was great food and very basic service / as in having to get back up from the table and walking to to bar to get more drinks and condiments and napkins, numerous times  - despite being literally 4 of the 10 people in the place - and that's counting 2-4 staff members.  So that was interesting. 

The second time was during a VGK game. Lots of people - not much going on in terms of people eating or ordering and a lot of staff - no acknowledgement whatsoever despite trying to flag someone down - until someone from the staff yelled out - "free shirt for whomever writes the next 5 star yelp review!l That was disheartening. 

So we left. The food was good enough the first time, for us to return and try again. Maybe some other time.

This local bar rocks!!!!
The Burgers are awesome. 
Bartenders are friendly and helpful. 
A must in Vegas.

The food here is amazing! My favorites are the Americana Burger, the Chicken Fingers and The Zucchini Fries. Must try! The service is pretty good too, but we always have the best nights when Anna is our bartender because she always keeps our glasses full and she's so fun to talk to! She makes us want to come back all the time!

I've dropped into Bar Code many times before but never actually hung out there.  I would go to support my secret boo Tino's weekly comedy show that he hosted there. (In my head he was my boo, but don't tell him).  I would go to support the local comedians, maybe chit chat for 20mins or so and go home. Well in the past 3 days, I've been back twice since Saturday night.  I've been sleeping on this spot, literally up the street from me, this is you ULTIMATE local hang out spot.  

Bar Code is located on on Flamingo (nw), in between Tamarus and Spencer. sits facing the street.  At times some may perceive 'local' as some little dim-lighted hole in the wall, a place that is filled with smokey, sticky floor and old mismatched stools .  This is not that kind of place, well-lighted, in the day time natural light is giving light to the bar, so the house light are low.  At night, lights are up; not too dark not too light.  Outdoor seating is available and TV mania, on every wall, above the bar, in the little corner areas of the bar.  It doesn't matter where you sit/stand you will see whatever sport that is showing that day.  Very clean establishment, facilities clean and even though smoking is allowed, the ventilation is so great you can't even tell. Which is very important to me, especially when I'm going to eat there...epic side eye.  Dare I say 'Cheers for the 21st centry', huh, huh?  C'mon, manager was on the floor the entire time.  Here's the thing, I didn't even realized he was the manager until he introduced himself.  Once the game started it got busy, Brent help with orders, making drinks, cleaning tables, moving chairs around.  He never sat down, when he wasn't cleaning or serving he was mingling and interacting with customer.  Hence he stopped by our table to ask about our experience thus far and how did we like it.  (That's very Sam Malone-ish) The way the entire crew worked was like an orchestra, if the Knights played like the service that was happening in the bar WE would be up 2 instead of down 2 and coming home in a must win situation. (that's neither here NOR there).  

Got there around 430p, HAPPY HOUR is from 3p - 6p.  Awesome menu, great selections, prices range from $3.95 - $10.95, very reasonable.  As soon as sat down, I was greeted, id requested and order taken all in the 1st 5mins of me sitting down.  Talk about customer service YES PLEASE, and Thank you!  Yelp America let me introduce you to our bartender/server was LAUREN! (she freaking ROCKS), so on point with the service, excellent customer service.  The bar got busier as the game went on and yet she worked the hell out of her area.  We were all help in a timely matter, there was never a time that I was looking around to order anything,  Before I could Lauren was already there or had already checked on us.  We didn't have to worry about empty glasses, water always filled. Very cool laid back type personality, super cool vibes, very chill individual.  Y'all go check Lauren out, she is there everyday at 4p.

This is a local bar that is giving out lots of local love.  If you are in the area go check it out, go visit Lauren and Brent


We order the fried pickles, deviled eggs and bangin' wings:
5STARS - fried pickle: well seasoned crunchy outside, firm crunchy pickle inside.  So damn good, I forgot there was a sauce, you don't even need the sauce, they are fine alone.  But the sauce, eh y'all that sauce tho...it's a  creamy Sriracha ranch, I'm just saying, I almost took my finger an ran it out the inside of that cup.  Together it's a nice little explosion.

1STAR - deviled eggs: the presentation was nice, but I was really feeling it.  For me personally it was way heavy with Worcestershire sauce, it over powered my palate, that was the only thing that I could taste.  And, they a were runny...I'm sorry...and this is why you try to make happy hour, therefore you can try something at a fraction of cost, it's 50/50.  This was not to my liking, this is just my opinion, go try them out for yourself and make your own call on them.

5STARS -  bangin' wing: fried wing, no flour, no batter, tossed in a in-house bbq sauce.  The bbq sauce is reminiscent of Carolina style but has a little more sugar than a vinegar based bbq sauce would have.  Has a kick to it, the heat kind out sneaks up on you.  Even tossed in sauce, the skin was still crispy an chicken super moist.  I'm a not a blue cheese person, so I went ahead and had ranch on the side, like the true fat @$$ that I am.  Oh my happy fat heart, yes I'm still dancing

Hands down, best burger in town.  So many good choices but Joe was great and suggested burger of the month and didn't let me down.  Definitely the go to spot with such a clean place and friendly environment.   
GO KNIGHTS GO!

Definitely a good burger/bar which includes smoking. The burgers are good, but I love Bachi Burgers more. The service was very nice and friendly. Cool place to hang out for a bar scene with video poker machines. I definitely will be back during Happy Hour and late night.
Food was mostly above average prices were fair but the service was lousy! 2 tables and couldn't ever come and check on us! Waited 30 mins to get the check after I had to get up and ask for it!!
Good burgers I liked it, service slow, I find it strange only one bar tender/food service for a Saturday felt like I was on the back burner when I sat away from the bar:(

Bar/burger joint located on Flamingo.

The location is predominantly a bar with low lighting and plenty of video poker. There are plenty of tables to sit at but it does smell like smoke. 

There was a good selection of draft beers and the menu had plenty of burger selections. I had the classic burger which was delicious. It was served with fries.

The staff was super friendly and accommodating.

We stopped in yesterday for happy hour and watch the football game. Anthony the bartender was awesome he was on top of it with the drinks and our food came out within minutes after ordering. We had almost everything on their happy hour menu. This was great tasting !! the dipping sauce for the fried zucchini was zesty and a hint of spice, the squad and chicken wings was perfect and hot. We really enjoyed ourselves even had shots with the group of girls next to us.
Amazing service. The food was surprisingly quick. I had the chicken strippers....very tasty! I'll be back for sure. Thank you guys.

I really wanted to give this place 5 stars, but the smell when you walk in just hits you. This place is NOT "no smoking".

We tried 2 of the burgers. The Americana Burger & The BBQ Big Burger. Both were excellent. Both were served with house made fries and Siracha ketchup. The Americana is pickles, onion strings, mustard, & ketchup with American cheese. The BBQ is Boston Butt, cheddar, & blueberry BBQ sauce.

I, also, had the Jade Budda cocktail which was a kiwi/lime concoction. It was super light, refreshing. A perfect summer cocktail. Kudos to Anna for dreaming it up and sharing it with the world!!

The best part of this dining experience, aside from the fantastic burgers, was the stellar service. We never waited long for anything and both people that helped us just seemed happy to be there...Which made us happy to be there.

Despite the cloud of smoke you have to go through to get here... It's worth checking out. I could see this being our new burger place.

I live close to this place. They have great food and great service. My favorite so far are the chicken strips at happy hour. I also enjoyed the bar code burger. Drinks are definitely self explanatory. Try it. For the price you will be satisfied.
I love this bar!  The staff is awesome and nice.  The foods delicious.  Word of advice get the chicken strippers.

Stumbled upon this place on my way to the strip during a random trip to Vegas and boy, am I glad I did.  The friendly atmosphere provided by the servers was the first to stand out as it was a very pleasant atmosphere. There were multiple sports playing on all the TVs and the bartender did not hesitate to turn on a game I wanted to watch.  The food here is absolutely dynamite! I started with the devilled eggs which were the best I have ever had. They were absolutely amazing.   I followed this with the lamb burger and some fries and i must say I could not believe how good it tasted. I have eaten plenty of lamb burgers and have never had one so tasty before. I am thoroughly impressed with this establishment and will definitely be back. Also, the owner and his wife were in the bar bussing tables and interacting with customers and they were extremely nice people. I highly recommend you check this place out if in Las Vegas.

This is my go-to Vegas Knights Bar!!! I know there are plenty of awesome places to view the game in town but Bar Code keeps me coming back every game. If you want a fun atmosphere with a bunch of Knights fans who are lively and into the games, this is the bar for you. 

One bonus is that the food is delicious. The BBQ Burger is my main staple here but I've tried the tots, Squid vicious and a majority of the appetizer menu as well

Come out and let's watch the Knights win the Cup!! Go Knights!!

I have been going to this location as a bar patron over the course of ten years. It has changed names and themes multiple times during my patronage. I can say that Bar Code is by far the best scenario that this address has seen in that ten years. Location is very central- near UNLV and short ride from the Strip. Very clean and open space.Outdoor patio as well.  The menu is awesome! Try the wings ( ask for extra crispy) and the burgers are a must!  There is calamari, zucchini fries, and other yum bar fair with a notch up.  Drinks are all yummy. The kiwi thing is super bomb ( forgot name) ;)   Plenty of diverse beers on tap and service is on task. There is a pool table, darts, shuffle board and karaoke (check for nights/hours). Jukebox available and buzztime trivia, multiple tvs and gaming.( and for those that still find this odd in Vegas - yes, its a smoking establishment) No possible way you can be bored while hanging out here. I gotta admit I have one complaint tho- the blue cheese dressing is horrendous. I know not that many people choose it over ranch but I do and seriously- don't do it man! I tipped the cook ten bucks last visit just to beg his boss to change it up.   ---- Yep other than that though, order ranch and have a kick ass time here. Happy Hour daily 3-6 (7days a week) and there is a late night happy hour as well since its a 24/7 bar.  Great job guys! Keep kickin it!

This bar scared the crap out of me! The bartenders get very annoyed and irritated when you ask for something. I don't think I could trust this bar, if I was in the same foxhole with them. The place needs a huge attitude adjustment and needs to change. Just like we all do. Instead of pointing the finger at customers, take time to make them feel at home.
There bloody Marty's are fantastic! Staff is friendly, and they have good chicken!  Will be back!

came here today for the first time for the knights game. it's been an amazing experience. the food and drinks are great, the atmosphere is great, and of course the customer service is friendly and welcoming. will definitely be returning. the fries here are amazing. if you have not been here, this is the best sports bar to come in las vegas for locals. and don't forget #nocaps! go knights go!!!!!!
This place was random, but absolutely perfect. The patio was chill, the food was delicious. We got the 2am tots and the fried pickles. A must try!!!

Great atmosphere, very spacious and comfortable, they also have great music playing and a jukebox so you can pick your own. I Love the fact that they have a shuffle board and pool table so it isn't just a get drunk and get out type of environment, it's more of a place to come with some of your friends, and hangout, play pool, drink, and have a good time. It is also fairly large so it isn't too smokey inside, which is a good thing. They have a really good happy hour with cheap drinks and good food choices like wings, fingers, fried pickles, onion rings, fries etc. Everything you would want when you are drinking their wide selection of beers! They also have very decent prices when it's not happy hour. This is my first time here, so I can't give it a five star yet, but I will be definitely coming back here, and will update this review the more I get to know this place.

Thisbplace kinda let me down to day gave me not all the way cooked chixked ... Eh ... Dont really wanna come here ever again ... Hope i dont get fuckin sick .... Patty from sandwitch was like rubber...so gross :'(
I ordered the bar code burger along with the loaded hash browns and everything was great including the service.  There was a standup comedian performing who was pretty funny as well!

awesome location right down the street from where I work. perfect for grabbing a drink after a long day. Mason always makes the best cocktails and is very passionate about mixology and bar tending. the food and atmosphere is great too. will continue to keep coming back! lots of games and things to do.
Great place. Awesome food. Attended what turned out to be a charity event for #VegasStrong. Fantastic turnout with friends from all over the Gaming Industry. This pic.....#cucumberinyourass
Best place in Vegas!!!. Great selection of burgers. Great staff. Stop in when you are in Vegas. You won't be disappointed.

We love this bar!! Great service and the best  atmosphere!!! Hands down the best burgers in town. Also love the fried pickles and my fianc√© loves the turkey burger. Awesome place to watch the VGK game!

Great place to chill. Fun to watch Golden Knights games, Cold beer. Loose slots, there's a Pool Table, Darts, And Shuffle board... oh and Karaoke! Check it out if you're in the area... order the chicken strips wow! 10/10.

If you enjoy not hearing anything except the blaring music this is your place. Food was greasy and not edible. Tried to get the waiters attention but was unable to pull him away from the pretty girls at the other end of the bar.

Ordered the bison burger from Anna the bartender. Loved the food and Anna was totally the most dope bartender ever!! Loved it!! Highly recommend the food and Anna made the whole experience even better!! Loved it I will certainly be back!!

Went for the first time this past thursday & i WILL be returning!! Best burgers in town thus far!! Juicy, thick & full of flavor! The server was really friendly & helpful with the menu. I ordered the Green Chili burger, which happens to be one of their most popular burgers, my fianc√© ordered the hangover burger, both delicious! Andrea was our server & she explained how they do not use reg ground beef, but a mixture of brisket & beef. Also ordered the tator tots & deviled eggs as appetizers, the tots were great but the eggs had a lil too much mustard in their mix. Over all great local bar with great non regular burgers!!
Great place to watch the Knights games! The food is delicious and the drinks are cheap! Staff is all super friendly, always a good time when I go in.

Huge open layout, friendly staff, cold delicious beer, and outstanding fresh food.  What more could you ask for in a bar?  On yeah they are open 24/7. 

I met a group of friends around 7:30 and upon entering noticed how well lit and clean it was for a bar and there is a patio.  

Ordered my first beer from the bartender she was super fast and personable.  We ended up placing 3 banks of tables together in the back since our group was 16.   We looked over the menu, conversed and caught up on old times.

The bartender came over and was our now our server.  I ordered a half order of the zucchini bikini fries and the Green Chile Cheeseburger with fries.  The waitress informed the group there is only 1 cook tonight so to be please patient.  I have no problem with that a appreciate the honesty instead of waiting and wondering if they forgot my order. 

The ZUCCHINI BIKINI FRIES :  extremely tasty, the tempura batter was so light and it was cooked to perfection I loved 

The GREEN CHILE CHEESEBURGER: Super juicy and flavorful with just the right amount of luck a very hearty burger indeed.  The fries were amazing as well with the siracha ketchup.  

I did try the SQUID VICIOUS as well again extremely light batter and cooked perfectly.

The quality of the food is above and beyond what you'ld expect in a bar atmosphere and that is a great thing!  Will be coming back perhaps next time to play shuffleboard, darts or to shoot some pool.

Happy Yelping
Great food, best service, great prices, great games pool, darts and more. Happy hour specials and great selection of drinks and draft beers. Will definitely come back!

I discovered Bar Code through Instagram, so after scrolling thru their page the food looked delicious and I knew I had to try it! 

Upon walking in my company and I were greeted by a female bartender, we found our own seats and then were quickly informed on the happy hour specials. I ordered a Blue Moon with an orange and was informed that they did not carry this beer, but was recommended shock top instead.  

After deciding on an appetizer and entree (calamari, BBQ burger, & the barcode burger) the appetizer came out first extremely quick, the calamari and sauce were excellent and was a good size portion per the happy hour deal. 

As soon as we were finishing our appetizer, the burgers were brought out. The display was decent but the burgers were amazing, I've never had a better burger, I ordered the Big BBQ Burger medium rare and it was amazing, I also had a bite of the Barcode Burger and it was even better! My only suggestion would ask for less oil on the bun it almost took away from the burger. 

In all my experience at the Bar Code was definitely enjoyable, I would indefinitely recommend it if anyone needs a good burger spot, and I will be there again to try another burger!

Been to Bar Code on several occasions now. And, I must say, every single visit has been equally fucking amazing!!! Even if they didn't have that amazing Hangover burger, or the legit selection of tap beers, I would come for the service alone. The graveyard squad showed me major love tonight on my birthday. Shout out to Daniel for simply being him. See you soon

Great place. I had the green chile burger. Sooooo good! Burgers are definitely big enough to share but I would suggest that you get more than one anyway so you can try the different options. My date got the American burger and he raved about it. The barcode sauce is amazing although I have no idea what's in it.

Another visit to one of the best kept secrets on the East side of town!

Far from your basic neighborhood bar food, Bar Code delivers on the classics but with a twist, sticking with the basics and executing well!

Venturing in during happy hour, the order turned appetizer heavy to capitalize. Great value daily from 3-6pm & 11pm-2am, along with drink deals as well.

I've tried quite a few burgers here, and on this visit, the "Hangover Burger" ($11.95) : Bacon, Fried Egg, American Cheese, Fried Onion, Code Sauce & Fresh Kennebec Fries. Excellent breakfast style burger, good for any hour! Very fatty, juicy & messy, steakhouse thick patty, nice crunch bringing it together. Too bad the patty was overcooked this time, but still enjoyable even at medium well.

A must have every visit, the "Chicken Strippers" ($6.95 HH) : Buttermilk Brine, House-Spiced Breading & Code Sauce. Extraordinary fingers, very juicy with a delicate breading, full of spice & flavor. Recommended!

And of course, the "Pickle Schnitzels" ($3.95 HH) : Spicy Dill Chips & Sriracha Ranch. Great rendition, thinly sliced and crispy, with a bit of salt. I love fried pickles, and this one is a steal at the portion and price during Happy Hour.

Check them out on E Flamingo near Maryland!

Called a burger bar and has pictures of food outside but it is an over 21 only bar. Don't promote as a food first establishment if you only cater to bar patrons. Took about 5-10 mins of us seating ourselves before someone looked inconvenienced enough to come ask for ID.

I love Bar Code for the following reasons: 1) It is clean 2) The service is awesome 3) The food is amazing, and 4) It's close to UNLV. There are not a ton of great locals places around campus to eat and not many bars that are clean and safe for a girl to go to. Although not in walking distance, Bar Code is a quick drive from campus and worth the travel for the Code sauce and awesome food. I have not tried the salads but have been with others several times when they were ordered and heard positive feedback. The restrooms are also very clean and well lit which is a different experience from a lot of area bars. I have not played pool or shuffle board but I saw that they were available there as well. Awesome place for locals!

Good food , great service and decent prices.
The Bar Code burger was great . 
For sports fans there is a big number of large screens to watch your favorite game on , pretty noisy, but it's a bar type environment.
Andrea was our server , she was very attentive and so friendly, what a bubbly personality, she made our visit so enjoyable.

A few members of my cohort met at Bar Code to celebrate the end of another semester. We decided on Bar Code due its close proximity to UNLV and because of its stellar reviews on Yelp. Our visit happened to coincide with Bar Code's happy hour (3-6PM), which as perfect for us. 

Franziskaner Weissbier ($5 HH): Similar to a Hef, this beer was light and smooth. 
House Wine ($4 HH): Crazy cheap wine that was actually pretty decent tasting. Bar Code had multiple house wines to choose from. I went with the cab. 

Not Your Mom's Tots ($3.95 HH): I think these tots were among the best I've ever had! According to the waitress, most items on the menu are made from scratch, including the tots. They were served piping hot and were absolutely delicious. The 'code' sauce served with the tots amplified the goodness x10. 5/5

The bartender was awesome. She checked in on us frequently and even kicked out a creepy geezer who was bothering us. Kudos to her! The vibe of the bar was a little off though, which is why I rated Bar Code 4 stars versus 5. The music is pretty loud here and very random, going from NSYNC to Alice in Chains. This place definitely has potential, I think they just have to find their niche.

YELP 100 CHALLENGE 2016: #80

Recently celebrating their first anniversary, an eastside location not far from UNLV placing the 24/7 joint far from tourists and their unwavering willingness to pay Holsteins or Gordon Ramsay $15+ for nothing more than an All-Beef Patty, Lettuce, Tomato, Onion, Mayonnaise, Ketchup and a Pickle, Bar Code is something of a hidden gem for in-the-know locals, Executive Chef Joe Valdez and his team turning out Food far better than they need to at a price that low-balls The Strip without sacrificing creativity or quality.

Difficult to peg as a place for craft Cuisine from the street, a single story along East Flamingo near Blueberry Hill and the Sketchers Outlet largely blending into the background with a sign that simply suggests it might be a good place to "Eat / Drink / Play," those entering Bar Code will find the interior surprisingly modern, several LCD Televisions centrally located and perfect for watching sports while well-lit alcoves contain darts, shuffleboard and pool tables.

At this point amassing a fair number of regulars, the lunch and after-work crowd said to get fairly large in addition to the typical flow of traffic on game days, it was with greetings from a lone bartender/server that two friends were seated just past 5:30 on a Saturday featuring little more than the NFL Preseason, Chef Valdez present along with one other in the kitchen and happy to chat about his background which started here in Valley before stints in Colorado and years working in the Red Robin test kitchen.

Present at Bar Code from the start, a gig as Sous-Chef quickly seeing him advance to the lead role thanks to hard work and a willingness to go the extra mile in order to make the Restaurant's collection of Burgers, Sides and Salads stand out in a city where there is never a lack of competition, it was after several minutes of candid conversation with Chef Valdez that the decision was made to defer an order to the young man, the meal divided into two Appetizers, two Burgers and "Dessert" lasting just under an hour as the Rams took on the Cowboys.

Not drowning out the game sounds with a jukebox, a welcome change compared to places like Aces & Ales or B.A.R. that cannot seem to get enough Journey or Def Leppard regardless of the time or event, it was after a few minutes further perusing the menu that Joe emerged from the kitchen carrying two trays including the lightly fried "Squid Vicious" and hand-breaded Chicken Strippers, the Calamari tender and nicely spiced beneath a crispy coat of Panko while the later was Pickle-brined and herbal with a lightly adherent layer of breading that was flavorful and practically oilless.

So far so good, the Code Sauce of Ketchup, Mayonnaise and "secret" Spices pairing well with both Appetizers and advisably kept to sauce Fries, it was after another ten minutes that Chef Valdez once again arrived tableside with two of Bar Code's signature Burgers, the 70/30 blend of Brisket, Short Rib and Chuck forming a juicy backbone to housemade Blueberry BBQ, Pulled Pork and freshly fried Bacon on the BBQ Big Burger while the restaurant's eponymous signature gets funky and fragrant with Beer-braised Onions, Bacon Aioli and Blue Cheese.

Grilling the Buns before service and making every Sauce, Jam or Aioli on-site, a labor intensive process most would not expect from a Video Poker and Sports Bar so far east of Las Vegas Boulevard, it was after a few too many fresh-cut Fries had been eaten that Chef Valdez at last arrived with "Breakfast for Dessert," the French Strippers described as a dish he'd invented for his girlfriend making one say "what waffles?" as hand-trimmed strips of Chicken Breast brined in Buttermilk were just as crunchy and juicy as those served earlier, but without the Dill and instead laid on a bed of custardy Challah Bread with Fresh Strawberries, Whipped Cream and Housemade Strawberry-Vanilla Maple Syrup.
